main event: Multiple objects appearing as lights were spotted hovering and moving in a linear fashion over Kenton, Ohio on October 10, 1960.
interesting points: The objects were described as the size of a baseball and moving in a linear fashion for 3-5 minutes.
The objects appeared to emit a bright, static light that was much whiter than the stars.
One of the objects appeared to be shooting reddish sparks at 10-20 minute intervals without any noise.
The witness was fairly certain about the details of the sighting.
This was the first time the witness had seen an object like this.
sighted object: Multiple bright, static lights moving in a linear fashion
